section.name: Q. How do I build the persondirectory.jar library
section.p:
Retrieve it from CVS. And build it using
Maven
.

section.name: Q. How do I use the persondirectory.jar library in general.
section.p: The libraries persondirectory-<version>.jar and persondirectorytests-<version>.jar are installed through the maven build so that subsequent maven projects can see them through their maven project.xml <dependency> tag.
The two jars will eventually be placed onto the uPortal site to allow automatic retrieval.
These Libraries provide both the IPersonAttributeDAO interface and various adapted technologies through this interface.
The libraries explicit usage is different for the various types of adapters and facades in the library. Below are questions answering usage relating to documented adapters/facades.

section.name: Q. How do I use the persondirectory.jar library for LDAP.
section.p: A standard JNDI call can acquire the LDAP context by name in this release. An LdapContext should be returned. This context can come from JVM -D parameters, the jndi context, or from custom configuration if you manually construct the properties Hashtable as below.
